reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI played this game while at PAX South and love it. Bought it while i was there for half price. Currently does not support online play but it does support local co-op play and is a blast and makes a great party game. Even at its current state i recommend the game. They are still updating so be on the look out for the online play soon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Oh man, this game. I first tried this at PAX Prime 2015, and ended up revisiting the booth the whole weekend to keep playing.

The ideal way to play this really is with 7 friends locally, although the computers aren't awful to play against. It's already incredibly polished for local play, and the developers have said they're working on making the online functional, although I personally haven't tried it yet.

There's a ridiculous amount of content for the price, and once you play it with friends once you won't regret it. It creates a lot of the same moments I remember playing 4-player bomberman on the snes. Tense, interesting, and fast-paced multiplayer couch combat. I probably should have started with that, but oh well.

Seriously, get this game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nKnight Squad was probably designed with the idea, What if Gauntlet had online multiplayer?" While the game modes consist of your standard fare deathmatch
hoursPlayed: etc the real heart of the game is in its gameplay and mechanics. Players begin with a short sword but
voteText: through Bomberman styled pickups
votesFunny: and crossbows. One hit kills but respawns are quick creating a fast paced feel to the game that suits it well. The only fault with the current build is that all matches will be played with AI bots. Online multiplayer and a campaign are on the way though so this issue will eventually be rectified.\n\nOn the other hand the best part about this game
column16: is the inclusion of local mulitplayer. With the industry standard of making games without local multiplayer
column17: this is a breath of fresh air. Playing this with a few friends reminded me of all of the great times I had playing 2v2 Smash Bros. Might I say that this is no small feat to accomplish. I still hold Smash Bros to be the best party game for local multiplayer. In fact
column18: both games feature "fun chaos" when first learning the systems and both have a great deal of depth/strategy despite both having appeal to non core games.\n\nI am eager to see what Chainsawsome Games does with the future of this title. Whatever they do with it
column20: it is off to a great start.\n\n"

Knight Squad è un frenetico gioco per 1-8 giocatori ambientato in una caotica arena che metterà a dura prova le tue amicizie! Sfida gli amici, e futuri nemici, in ognuna delle divertentissime modalità di gioco, dalla Sfida all'Ultimo Uomo al Calcio Medievale. Tutto questo usando solo armi medievali... e pistole laser...


Features:
- Multigiocatore fino a 8 giocatori online!
- Tante modalità diverse fra di loro
- Usa la tua arma preferita: spada, arco e frecce, balestra, bombe, pistola laser e molto altro!
- Supporto al Gamepad
- Supporto alle carte Steam


Parere personale:
Knight Squad è un gioco molto divertente, ci sono tantissime modalità, tutte diverse!
Per esempio: c'è il classico deatchmatch oppure cattura la Bandiera a squadre, Sfida all'Ultimo Uomo, Cattura il Graal, il calcio e tante altre!
E' possibile giocare sia in singolo , contro BOT, che online con gli amici!

Insomma è un gioco veramente riuscito, che potrebbe portarvi via la vita sociale!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

NOTE: Knight Squad is in Early Access and that means this will be a much more condensed review than a final release review. As soon as the game launches I will have a final release review which would be a much more descriptive review. Thanks!

Knight Squad is a 1 to 8 player indie game created and published by Chainsawesome Games. It is available on Steam's Early Access program for the low price of $9.99. The game puts you in the point of view of bird's eye view and allows you to control one out of eight knights. You will control your knight to defeat all other opponents that stand in your way. As the player, you may choose one of the six game modes, each mode having two maps (with the exclusion of Soccer's one map). On top of picking a game mode and a unique map, made exclusively to a certain game mode, you can choose whether you would like bots to play with you, if you are alone. You may set the bots to have a certain difficulty out of the four choices (Easy, Medium, Hard, and Extreme). With whatever mode you choose, whether it's easy or even extreme, you will be challenged as the AI is very well programmed to fight you. How does it hold up?

Knight Squad surprised me. I haven't had this fun playing with my brother and six other bots in years. The AI challenged us to even use teamwork when we were on the same side. With all the powerups and weapons that are thrown at you from enemies, you're gonna need to move quickly to avoid arrows, lasers, and even KAMIKAZES! The list goes on for a while, including ninjas - which fight by your side as you fight enemies - and even being able to drill your way through the map's blocks. You will have a lot of fun with this game, especially as more maps and gamemodes are being added. And, like every review has said so far, I can't wait to kick some butt on online multiplayer!

8.5/10 - Knight Squad is already rivaling some of the best multiplayer games that have come up within the past 5 years, and it's only going to keep getting better! Well done Chainsawesome Games!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Knight Squad is a great big-screen local multiplayer game, for both competition and coöperation.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth and complexity provided by the different game styles - the classics like Deathmatch, Last Man Standing, and Capture the Flag work well and are predictably enjoyable; while the less-common Domination, Gladiator, Crystal Rush, and Grail modes add breadth and depth to the experience.

While pummeling other humans is enjoyable, the AI is no pushover either - after getting pummeled in our first round of Crystal Rush by the Easy AI, one of our group commented, OK guys
date: I think we're going to have to actually employ a strategy this time."\n\nThe different weapons/powerups/modifiers provide plenty of variety
recommended: and the ability to combine weapon pickups is a nice touch.\n\nRan perfectly on my Ubuntu 14.04 machine."

reviewText:
Just picked this game up in a humble bundle. At least, i think it was a bundle... I jumped in to this game to check it out and I've only now surfaced for air.

Controls delightfully simplistic. A heap of different game modes- a ton in fact. And it's not like other games where there is one or two good game modes and the rest are ♥♥♥♥♥. All these game modes are fun and challenging:

Capture the flag
Capture the grail (everyman for himself CTF)
juggernaught
tdm
soccer
crystal bash or something
seriously a ton of game modes and they're all hilarious.

Online and local multiplayer. controller support. Just fun seriously.

Arcady, hilarious, very very VERY fun. And i haven't even played with mates yet.

10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Knight squad is a simple, top view, competitive combat game.

At its intitial release it already felt like a complete game, and yet I have yet to play an early access game with as much content released as frequently as knight squad.

The combat is simple, all buttons do the same thing, attack. There are, however, various weapons and powerups that spawn.

Knight Squad has a large range of game modes.

all vs all modes include:

- Last man standing
- A mode where points are aquired by staying alive in a central arena, and killing other players
- A where a player has a minigun - whoever kills him becomes the new jugganaut
- Grail - capture the grail and return it to your base to score points
- Kill players in a set order - the first to complete their list wins

team modes include:

- Soccer
- Caputre the flag
- King of the hill
- Destroy the enemies base

The modes are all thoughtfully done and original. Even the more common modes have some sort of twist to them.

Knight Squad is a brilliant party multiplayer game.

Subscribe to my curator page for more local multiplayer recommendations: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/7189360/

Check out my Couch Gaming group for specials, bundles, etc: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CGLM

reviewText:
Knight Squad is a party game. It can be played online and it is very fun that way, too, but it's just unstoppable with friends in the same room. There are a ridiculous number of game variances and each of them are totally excellent in their own way. This game can be hard to stop playing.

Also definitely worth mentioning: I had an issue with my controller support (wound up being a virtual joystick program I didn't know I had installed). #ChainsawsomeGames was entirely, completely, 100% supportive in helping me troubleshoot my issue. One of the best customer support exchanges of my life (and I'm 38 in September).

If you're looking for casual, hilarious PvP fun that could easily be taken as seriously as CS:GO or Starcraft if you really wanted, this game is absolutely worth your 15 USD. And that's even considering it's early access.

I could go on and on.

Are you old enough to remember having lots of fun playing against friends on Atari 2600? That old-school goodness is alive and well in Knight Squad. Four stars.

reviewText: Unbelievably terrible console port. Broken controls, multiplayer that only works when it is feeling like it, randomly changing screen resolution, and bugs everywhere. Rebinding controls does not work, as the game will only use keyboard controls, and ignore any controller inputs outside of the joysticks. Rebinding keyboard controls sorta work, if you ignore the broken button prompts. Whenever I can get joining lobbies to work, everybody has the same name as you, and the game randomly kicks you to the main menu. This game does not work with multiple monitors, blacking out anything other than the main screen. Luckily, I got this practically for free on the Humble Bundle, so I don't even have to refund it.

reviewText: Knight Squad is one hell of a game. It brings the nostalgia of old 80s arcade games such as Pac-Man and Gauntlet, but mixes it up with slightly better graphics and sound. It lives up to the fast-paced action and multi-player fun that once soothed the savage beast 20+ years ago. Featuring multiple game modes and challenges that can easily fit into your busy schedule, you can crack some skulls and chop up some centipede beasts within minutes and still make it to work on time! How many games can you possibly play that allow you to quickly play a few short rounds, blow off steam, and still have fun before you're off to take care of responsibilities? Not many.\nThe soundtrack is perfectly fitting with the swords and sorcery gameplay, sounding as epic as the hack-slash adventure itself. Play against friends, enemies, and random opponents and beat your highest score over and over again! Survive and long as you can and destroy as many beasts and knights as you can to claim you are the greatest knight in all of... well, whatever kingdom you may lay claim to when you're sitting in front of your PC busting heads with your keyboard or gamepad. If you have 5 minutes to spare, a yearn to capture some hills, and are willing to give nostalgia a chance then download Knight Squad and let's play.

reviewText:
Essentially the perfect party game.

Controls are brilliant, smooth, and incredibly simple. Anyone can play it, even those who don't regularly game. You move around and press x to attack, doesn't get any more simple than that.

The fast paced gameplay is varied and exciting enough to keep you and 7 friends hooked for hours.

Warning: Will cause screaming, swearing, and tears of joy as you mercilessly slaughter your friends after hoarding the power ups.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's a very fun game, but the game is still in early access and these has not been any updates in a while. The game needs a little more in my opinion. But it's Very awesome while it lasts. Some ideas: A map editor, an option to maybe arrange teams, EX: your friend thinks he's way too good at the game, so what if you could make the game a 4v1 against your friend? There IS an online multiplayer mode, but it's empty most of the time. Also can there be a way that me and my friend can play on the same computer? Something like I have WASD and he has the arrow keys? There is so much more to add, But otherwise and overall I recommend this game to anyone.

One of those fun games i like to pass the time with a friend or friends when waiting to play another game or just feel like playing something different although the match making can be annoying if your trying to have a private match since not many people seem to be in lobby at one time but that wont stop me from buying the dlc and enjoying this game more.

*Controller recommended but not needed*
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Highly recommended 8-player game.  This is one of the few couch games you can play locally with 8 friends and have a blast.  If you have the controllers and the setup, this is the game to play.  It's similiar to Bomberman but with tons of team battles and various modes.  Played this game at PAX and just played it 5 hours straight last night with some buds.  Well worth your money!
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: A great top down multiplayer game. It's fun to play with friends and has a surprisingly hard challenge mode for when they aren't there. You want to try to get a 2nd horse powerup, because rainbows.

reviewText: Very easy game to pick up but modestly challenging to play.  Pretty good game when you've got a few controllers and friends to play with, though not so great when playing alone.  I suppose online multiplayer would be ok but still not as fun as doing it with friends.\n\nThis may be playable on keyboard, but I wouldn't recommend doing so.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Lets start off with, that this game doesnt seem to be that popular, its a real shame. I absolutely love the game modes, characters and challenges of this game, but none of my friends have it. I wish more people I knew had this game, its a very fun over-head view game like the legend of zelda, it has a variety of characters weapons and gamemodes, very fun single player challenges at various difficulties, and a sense of exploration to some maps that have drills and certain blocks that can be drilled through, making your way through the map for the various objectives. Many good gamemodes (My personal favorite is juggernaught) Like capture the grail, capture the flag (team), jailbreak, deathmatch, gladiator, and much much more. Overall its just a plain good game! With power-ups and weapons such as the lightning staff, the ripper, speed boots, horses, shields, boomerangs, bombs, and SO much more than that! with varieties of knights like from Savior, to Selfie, this game just never stops being good. Good to play with friends, and I highly recommend playing with a controller, because its harder to aim with the keyboard. If you try it with the controller, and then go back to a keyboard- you would want to go back to the controller. Knight Squad is a highly good game. I really recommend a lot of people to try it.

reviewText: Game is fun in multiplayer, too bad no one is playing right now. Challeneges are unfair- trial and error type. Controller is a must, do not even think about using keyboard. You get different colored knights but waste of potential there - they could have used some RPG elements to those knights.\nTry it if you get it on bundle like i did otherwise stay away from it. You get 4/8 card drops and other 4 you can buy for under 25 cents.

reviewText: Amazing party game for local co-op as allows for 8 people to play. Keyboard controls are terrile but controller is good online community is noexistant though as only a few people on at one time. The dlc is also quite good as it has 4 new game modes which nicely sink into the feel for the game without making you feel like you need them and if one person has the dlc and goes online everyone in that game can play the map but cannont choose the 3 new characters.
